text: OREN LIEBERMANN: Line

has just moved up the hill,
from the base of the hill,
into Amona.

Right here behind me, you can
see they are still pouring in--

not only this line
here behind me,

but also another line
working its way up the hill.

Hundreds, if not more
than 1,000 police officers

surrounded by a ring of soldiers
that protects the outpost

and prevents any other
protesters from moving in.

We have seen hundreds of
protesters who are here.

They have backed off since
the police have moved in.

The evacuation of
Amona starting now.

This is an outpost
of some 40 homes

that was ruled illegal
by Israel's high court

because it was built on
private Palestinian land.

It has gone through a years-long
process, legal process,

as settlers and the right
wing tried to protect it.

But that process
ends here today,
as the police are moving in.

And you can see them
coming up the hill.

This is police officers
and some border police,

it looks like, moving
in to evacuate, remove

not only the 40 families, but
hundreds of youth, hundreds

of protesters that tried
to block the roads,

set tires on fire, set rocks
on the road to try to prevent
these officers from moving in.

Which as you can see, the
force that has come in here

from the Israeli side,
from the police officers,

to remove, evacuate, and
demolish the outpost.

That starting imminently, as
we see behind us here, Max.
-As we mentioned, Netanyahu is--

and his government are pushing
ahead with a rapid expansion
plan as well.
Why at this time, would you say?

OREN LIEBERMANN: Well,
the timing certainly
isn't coincidental there.

This, the evacuation of
this illegal outpost,

will spark a furious backlash
from right wing voters.

That is to say, from
Prime Minister Benjamin
Netanyahu's voter base.

So he needs to give them
something in exchange,

something in
return, and that was
the settlement announcement--

3,000 new settlement
homes, 2,000

to be advanced immediately, the
other 1,000 in varying stages.

But that was the move he made
to appease the right wing,

to appease the settlers and
the settlement enterprise.

That announced from not
only the prime minister,

but also from the
defense minister.

Also, of course, this is
the third announcement,

second from Netanyahu,
under President Trump,

the last one coming
just a week ago,
of 2,500 new settlement homes.

So all of this is what
Netanyahu has called a new era,

and he said this is just
the beginning of it.

So perhaps more
settlement homes ahead.

Yesterday, PLO
Secretary General,
the Palestinian response--

Secretary General
Saeb Erekat said

he encourages the ICC, the
International Criminal Court,

to investigate the
settlement enterprise.

And today, PLO executive
committee member Hanan Ashrawi

saying these thousands
of settlement homes

are the death of the
two-state solution.
